What is the future value (FV) he wants to achieve?
What is the annual interest rate?
Over how many years will the money be compounding?

Use the formula for compound interest: \(P = \frac{FV}{(1 + r)^n}\), where \(P\) is the principal amount (initial investment), \(r\) is the annual interest rate, \(n\) is the number of years, and \(FV\) is the future value.
Substitute the known values into the formula to calculate \(P\).
Round the calculated value of \(P\) to the nearest dollar.

5: Substitute the known values into the formula to calculate \(P\).
6: Round the calculated value of \(P\) to the nearest dollar.
